intro: Arundoclaytonia, commonly known as the small-flowered Claytonia, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Portulacaceae. It is native to the western United States and parts of Mexico, where it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. The plants typically have succulent leaves and produce small, white or pink flowers. They are often found in open, sun-exposed habitats such as grasslands and coastal dunes. Arundoclaytonia species are generally short-lived perennials, with some species exhibiting a mat-forming growth habit.
